bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Alton P. Tisdel, February 24, 1941

div1.p: Hench requests a large number of U.S. government publications published between 1898 and 1902. These documents are necessary for the preparation of a report to the Cuban government.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Alton P. Tisdel, February 24, 1941
div1.opener:
MAYO CLINIC
ROCHESTER, MINNESOTA
February 24, 1941
RECEIVED
SUPERINTENDENT OF DOCUMENTS
FEB
25
1941
DR. PHILIP S. HENCH
DR. CHARLES H. SLOCUMB
Mr. Alton P. Tisdel
Superintendent of Documents
U. S. Government Printing Office
Washington, D. C.
My dear Mr. Tisdel:
div1.p:
I am most anxious to obtain the following documents; is it possible for me to
do so and at what cost?
Group A.
(1) U. S. Adjutant General's office, Havana Dept.--Annual report of the
Commanding General 1898
(2) Same for 1899
(3) Same for 1900
(4) Same for 1901
(5) Same for 1902
Exhausted
Group B. Annual reports of the War Department
(1) for 1899--Exhausted
(2) for 1899--V. 1 pt. 2- 75¢ all other pts exhausted
(3) for 1900--V. 1 pt. 10- 30¢ " " " "
(4) for 1901--all exhausted
(5) for 1902--Vol. 8- 20¢ others exhausted
W1.1
Group C.
(1) Report of Brigadier General William Ludlow, U. S. Army, Military
Governor of Habana, 1899-1900.
(2) Cuba. Military governor 1899 (John R. Brooke) Havana 1899. This
is listed as F 1751.C97 in the Library of Congress.
(3) Cuba, Military governor, 1899 (John R. Brooke) Final report, Havana
1899. This is apparently different from the preceding and is
lished as F 1787.C953 in the Congressional Library.
(4) Civil report of Major-General John R. Brooke, U. S. Army, Military
governor, island of Cuba. Washington, Gov't print. off. 1900 (Pub-

pt. 6; also in 56th Cong., 1st Sess. House, Doc. 2.
(5) Cuba. Military governor, 1899-1902 (Leonard Wood) Civil report
1899-1900. Havana 1901.
(6) Report of the Military governor of Cuba on civil affairs (Dec. 20,
1899-Dec. 31, 1900) Washington, Govt. print. office, 1901 [1902]
(7) Cuba, Military governor, 1899-1902 (Leonard Wood) Civil report of
the military governor, 1901 Havana ? 1902

Washington, Gov't. printing off., 1902.

Exhausted

AIR MAIL

I have been asked to make a report to His Excellency, Dr. Domingo Ramos,
Minister of National Defense of the Cuban government, and I need these reports to
prepare it. Since my report must be made within the next three or four weeks, I would
be most grateful indeed if you could reply to this letter promptly, and I enclose
a stamped airmail special delivery envelope for your reply.

If it is not possible to obtain them through your office can you give me
the name of some old book store, perhaps in Washington, which might be able to find
them for me? I appreciate this help very much.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
